li.a: D20 Remote Learning Survey for Families
D20 Remote Learning Survey for Families

font.font: to translate into any language, select "
Translate Page
" at top right corne
r of web page

h5.strong: REMOTE INSTRUCTION WILL CONTINUE FOR ALL DISTRICT 20 STUDENTS THROUGH 5/29/2020.
ALL DISTRICT 20 SCHOOL BUILDINGS ARE CLOSED DUE TO STATE MANDATE THROUGH END OF THE 2019-20 SCHOOL YEAR.
CLICK HERE FOR THE D20 REMOTE LEARNING PLAN.

font.font: D20 IMPORTANT NOTICES
updated 04/17/2020

font.u: District 20 will continue Remote Learning through May 29, 2020

font.font: , following Governor Pritzker’s announcement today extending the school closure mandate through the end of this school year in order to maintain the health and safety of our communities.
We know that this will likely be a disappointment to many, and we want you to know that we will do all that we can to support your child and family.
4/17/2020 Remote Learning Feedback Letter to Families
Highlights:
Please provide us with your feedback on how the Remote Learning Program is going by completing the

a.data-page-name: D20 Remote Learning Survey for Families

font.font: D20 Remote Learning Survey for Families
For technology or Chromebook issues, please visit the
D20 Remote Learning FAQ
s. If you are unable to fix the issue yourself, please email D20 Technology Department at
. We have noted if the instructions have been updated recently.
For families without internet access, please click here for a map of
Free WiFi-Hotspot
drive-up locations across the state There are several locations within 5 miles of ESD20 where you can drive-up, park and utilize free WiFi.

div.div: Free Meals will still be available for pick-up on weekdays, please see the D20 Weekly Meal Schedule to begin 4/20.

font.font: Please Join the KEENEYVILLE D20 SPIRIT WEEK 4/20-24 to help spread our a positive Keeneyville Spirit across the district! Share pictures of your family showing the ESD20 SPIRIT to jrelihan@esd20.org!

div.class: fsDiv fsStyleOneThird fsStyleColumn fsStyleColumn-2 fsStyleColumn-last fsStyleAutoclear

div.em: The Illinois Department of Human Services Mental Health Division has launched CALL4CALM a free emotional support text line for Illinois residents experiencing stress and mental health issues related to COVID-19.

To speak to a mental health professional, text "TALK" to 5-5-2-0-2-0 or for Spanish "HABLAR" To 5-5-2-0-2-0. You can also text with key words like "unemployment" or "food" or "shelter" and receive information on how to navigate and access supports and services.

Social distancing is the practice of reducing close contact between people to slow the spread of infectious diseases. Social distancing measures include limiting large groups of people coming together, closing buildings and canceling events.

The guidelines below may help to explain what activities are recommended during this time. Please note that some of the locations/activities may have already been closed or restricted in your community.

img.alt: First page of the PDF file: SocialDistancing-Whatdoesitmean
